zeus.samples module¶

class zeus.samples.samples(nsteps, nwalkers, ndim)¶

Bases: object

Creates object that stores the samples. :param nsteps: Number of steps/generations. :type nsteps: int :param nwalkers: Number of walkers. :type nwalkers: int :param ndim: Number of dimensions/paramters :type ndim: int

append(x)¶

Append sample into the storage. :param x: Sample to be appended into the storage. :type x: ndarray

property chain¶
flatten(burn=None, thin=1)¶

Flatten samples by thinning them, removing the burn in phase, and combining all the walkers.

Parameters

  • burn (int) – Number of burn-in steps to be removed from each walker.

  • thin (int) – Thinning parameter (the default value is 1).

Returns

2D object containing the ndim flattened chains.

zeus.start module¶

zeus.start.jitter(x, nwalkers, ndim)¶

zeus.zeus module¶

class zeus.zeus.sampler(logp, nwalkers, ndim, args=None, kwargs=None, width=1.0, maxsteps=1, mu=2.5, normalise=False)¶

Bases: object

An ensemble slice MCMC sampler.

Parameters

  • logp (callable) – A python function that takes a vector in the parameter space as input and returns the natural logarithm of the unnormalised posterior probability at that position.

  • nwalkers (int) – The number of walkers in the ensemble.

property chain¶
flatten(burn=None, thin=1)¶
run(start, nsteps=1000, thin=1, progress=True, parallel=False)¶

Calling this method runs the mcmc sampler.

Parameters

  • start (float) – Starting point for the walkers.

  • nsteps (int) – Number of steps/generations (default is 1000).

  • thin (float) – Thin the chain by this number (default is 1 no thinning).

  • progress (bool) – If True (default), show progress bar (requires tqdm).

  • parallel (bool) – If True run the walkers in parallel (default is False).

slice1d(k_w)¶

Samples the next point along the chosen direction.

Parameters

k_w – frfdrg
